instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 No PM_SLP_S5_L
threads.message:
Water damaged board. Main corrosion around U7100. Repaired U7100 Area and now have 8.6V on PPBUS_G3H. Pulls .02 amp on DC power supply. 

PPBUS_G3H - 8.6v
PP5V_S5 - 5V
PP3v3_S5 - 3.3V
PP3v3_SUS - 0V
PPVRTC_G3H - 3.3V
RTC_RESET_L - 3.3V
SMC_RESET_L - 3.3V
PM_DSG_PWRGD -3.3V
I do have 32KHz Clock

No pulsing on either PM_SLP_S5_L or PM_SLP_S4_L when pulled in or SMC_ONOFF_L is shorted

threads.title: 820-00165 No PM_SLP_S5_L
threads.message:
Missing PM_SLP_SUS_L?
Post PCH_DSWVRMEN and PCH_INTRUDER_L.

threads.title: 820-00165 No PM_SLP_S5_L
threads.message: Ok this MacBook is now trolling me. Tested it this morning and now have PP3V3_SUS and PM_SLP_SUS_L. I have 2.7V on PCH_DSWVRMEN and 2V on PCH_INTRUDER_L.

threads.title: 820-00165 No PM_SLP_S5_L
threads.message: And i do have 3v3V on PM_SLP_S5_L

threads.title: 820-00165 No PM_SLP_S5_L
threads.message: Ok. I fixed it. For some reason its perfectly happy when a battery is plugged in. Charges and runs off battery just fine too.
